title: Tahrir Square during the Arab Spring uprising
brief_description: In 2011, the connectivity and speed of social media seemed promising for society and democracy. Platforms like Facebook, Twitter and YouTube were integral to mobilising people and coordinating protest movements like the Arab Spring, a series of anti-government protests, uprisings and revolutions.
